result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Robert Nigrelli

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Defendant Nicholas Robert Nigrelli appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Nicholas Robert Nigrelli.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Deft was not on the phone when cases originally called. Joins the call at 3:02pm.
Atty Cupino - Deft is trying to get a license, has an offer from the State and needs more time. Deft recently released from custody and needs to complete AODA assessment in order to obtain license.
Court suggests 60-90 days.
Atty Cupino agrees.
No objection from State.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on January 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.

(w/case #22CM310)
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law.

4:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Robert Nigrelli appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Nicholas Robert Nigrelli. 
Atty Cupino's Motion to Modify Bond - requesting lower cash bond not to exceed $100.00 or convert to signature bond.
State objects to modification of bond to signature bond, but leaves up to Court if lower cash bond is appropriate.
Court amends bond to $100.00 cash and all other conditions to remain the same.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
As to: Nicholas Robert Nigrelli re: Application and Order for Specific Judicial Assignment

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Robert Nigrelli appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Nicholas Robert Nigrelli. 
Given complaint-Advised of Rights-Bond set-NG plea entered-Probable Cause found in the complaint.
Case to go to Br. 3.
